subject: Categories in JUnit4?
msgSnippet: [Posted originally to the junit-devel mailing list, with a few different bits of content] Is anything planned in JUnit4 to mirror the Category attribute in
messageBody:
[Posted originally to the junit-devel mailing list, with a few different
bits of content]

Is anything planned in JUnit4 to mirror the Category attribute in NUnit?
For those who haven't used NUnit, this is an attribute which allows you
to classify a test fixture (test class) or indeed an individual test.
You can then tell NUnit to exclude certain categories or include certain
categories.

In my job, we're currently experimenting with the best way of developers
running tests across many different projects and platforms, and ways of
including system tests written using unit test tools. I *think*
categories would really help here, although I'm more than willing to be
told why there are better alternatives. They would allow tests to be
grouped in code according to what was being tested, but also allow for
certain tests to be marked as "very long running" (the kind of test
which might be done on a weekly basis rather than nightly) or
"performance" (functionality which is tested for correctness elsewhere,
but set up in this test to get performance measurements) etc.

I've seen a feature request for this on the SF site, but it talks of the
test runner doing the work - which would certainly allow whole classes
to be classified accordingly (although each runner would probably need
to implement the functionality), but the individual tests might be
somewhat harder to include/exclude, if the normal introspector is being
used.

Personally, I think this would be great functionality to have in the
core of JUnit4.

So, why am I wrong? :)
